message: Add a hack to ResteasyDispatcher (the core Servlet / Filter for framework apps) to recognise when we're running within an Azure App Service tomcat instance and fix up the HttpServletRequest based on the x-forwarded-proto header that Azure IIS sends after it unwraps https. This means that without changes to tomcat (which are difficult / impossible in Azure App Service) it's possible to get services accessed by https to redirect correctly to HTTPS endpoints rather than to HTTP endpoints and to ensure that isSecure() is true when the end-user is accessing the service via HTTPS (so that cookies can be marked as secure to bind sessions to HTTPS)
Add nonce check to config commit
add missing inject annoatation
fix make file
add make targets for deploying configuration service to a remote git repo
Release version 9.1.3
Start next development version 9.1.4-SNAPSHOT
Don't link users to their roles (they aren't permitted to access the role page so they'll just get an access denied error)
Allow admins to change user roles on the user pages, allow users ot see their own roles

Make sure that the User in the HTTP Session is always the same object as the User in the Guice SessionScope - otherwise impersonate could appear not to work (where the logged-in user would change but the UI templates would still use the details and privileges of the admin user)

Make Retry annotation aware of RestException/WebApplicationExceptions so that by default we don't retry when HTTP 401/403 errors are thrown (also don't retry if a 303 redirect is sent in response to an HTTP 401/403, this is a common redirect-to-login pattern)
Extend Retry logic to be smart about not retrying if a RestException is thrown with a specific set of codes (by default auth failure codes of 401 and 403)
Extend Retry logic to be smart about not retrying if a RestException is thrown with a specific set of codes (by default auth failure codes of 401 and 403)
Improve UI by not presenting admin options to non-admin users. Add the ability to impersonate another user if you're an admin
Release version 9.1.2
Start next development version 9.1.3-SNAPSHOT
Bugfix in UI created by changing how js extracts names from textarea elements
Add mockup of custom UI elements for well-known properties
Update HibernateModule to read a property file inline from hibernate.properties (like log4j.properties)

Instead of making the CurrentUser available on the HTTP Session, make it available through the currentUser templater variable (which also means the templater won't be calling CurrentUser methods directly, and as such we don't have to worry about OGNL having problems accessing default implementations of interface methods as if they were properties, which it still seems to have trouble with)
Make sure that the current user is always recorded as a top-level attribute in the HTTP Session (for access by templates)
Release version 9.1.1
Start next development version 9.1.2-SNAPSHOT

Add ability to edit Session endpoints (owner or admin)
Add ability to assign roles on creating a user (when an admin)
Add session-scoped nonces to edit forms for CSRF protection
Remove sample-rest-service (example of how to build a framework application is now available in the config service and user manager)
